intro: Pimpinella sisarum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy odor. Pimpinella sisarum typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
